ME # RHE
Hongkong Post Stamps
##I#
THE new Hong Kong International Airport at Chek Lap Kok comes into operation on 6 July
1998. This set of stamps commemorates this historic occasion.
Hong Kong International Airport will be supported by a dedicated road and railway network
linking it to the urban areas of Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. These transport links are
provided as part of the HK$155.3 billion Airport Core Programme.
The 24-hour airport will be user-friendly in every aspect. All essential facilities will be in one
terminal building, with its internal shuttle train called an Automated People Mover, a network of
travelators and an efficient baggage handing system. Hong Kong Skymall has 30,000 square
meters of retail space, with more than 140 shops, food and beverage outlets, banks and money-
claneers.
With the first of two runways in operation, the new airport will be able to handle 35 million
passengers and three million tonnes of air cargo annually. It will have 38 airbridge-served gates
for wide-bodied aircraft as well as 27 remote stands. On full development, the airport will be
able to handle 87 million passengers and nine million tonnes of air cargo.
The stamps depict some of the key facilities and service supporting airport operations. They
are: the passenger terminal's 2.5 kilometres of travelators ($1.30 stamp); the Automated People
Mover ($1.60 stamp); the Tsing Ma Bridge and Airport Railway ($2.50 stamp); the passenger
terminal building and the new Airmail Centre ($2.60 stamp); the passenger terminal's frontal
aircraft gates ($3.10 stamp); and the departures level of the passenger terminal building ($5.00
stamp).
